components.description: A British guardsman, known as a foot guard. Wears a tall black hat with a yellow chin-strap. Must look straight ahead at all times, even when tourists attempt to distract them.
components.title: Guardsman

description: A British guardsman, known as a foot guard. Wears a tall black hat with a yellow chin-strap. Must look straight ahead at all times, even when tourists attempt to distract them.
title: Guardsman

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Role symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A British guardsman, known as a foot guard. Wears a tall black hat with a yellow chin-strap. Must look straight ahead at all times, even whe http://emojipedia.org/guardsman/
emoji_net_data.name: guard

bn:00109142a: Intended or adapted to afford protection of some kind

bn:00098883a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Great Britain or its people or culture
Of or relating to Great Britain, Brits, or the British English language.

bn:00109969a: Of or relating to or indicative of or issued or performed by a king or queen or other monarch
Of or relating to a monarch or their family.

bn:00113751a: Suitable for wear or able to be worn

bn:00109139a: Kept safe or defended from danger or injury or loss

bn:00090041v: To protect; to keep from harm or injury.
Maintain in safety from injury, harm, or danger
To keep safe; to defend; to guard; to prevent harm coming to.
To keep something or someone safe or prevent harm coming to someone or something.
To protect from danger; to secure against surprise, attack, or injury; to keep in safety; to defend.
To prevent, to keep (from doing something).
To safeguard a resource from attack or loss.

bn:00092103v: Shield from danger, injury, destruction, or damage
To prevent against danger, injury, destruction, or damage.

bn:00068624n: A native or inhabitant of Russia

bn:00015784n: A head is the cephalic part of an organism, which usually comprises the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, each of which aid in various sensory functions, such as sight, hearing, smell, and taste.
A Head is the cephalic part of an animal, which usually comprises the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, each of which aid in various sensory functions, such as sight, hearing, smell, and taste.
The upper part of the human body or the front part of the body in animals; contains the face and brains
The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.

bn:00017926n: A member of a Hassidic movement in Jewish history.
A member of a Hassidic movement.

Hasidic Judaism from the, meaning "piety", is a branch of Orthodox Judaism that promotes spirituality through the popularization and internalization of Jewish mysticism as the fundamental aspect of the faith.
A member of a Jewish sect that observes a form of strict Orthodox Judaism

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

bn:00042043n: A person who, or thing that, protects or watches over something.
Person who or thing that protects something.
A person who keeps watch over something or someone
A person who protects or watches over something.

bn:00017718n: A covering for the head, often in the approximate form of a cone or a cylinder closed at its top end, and sometimes having a brim and other decoration.
An item of clothing worn on a person's head.
Headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim
A hat is a head covering.
"Chapeau" is a French term signifying a hat or other covering for the head.
An item of clothing intended to cover the head made from material hard enough to have a shape independant of the skull, and most commonly with a rim.

bn:00015398n: A close-fitting head covering either without a brim or with a peak.
A usually soft and close-fitting head covering, either having no brim or with a visor.
A cap is a form of headgear.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the guard emoji stands tall and vigilant, depicted in a classic uniform with a distinguished hat and coat, rendered with Apple's signature 3D gloss and depth.  The realistic lighting subtly highlights the textures of his attire, suggesting a sense of duty and protection.  This meticulously designed emoji conveys a feeling of security, authority, or the act of keeping watch, making it ideal for situations involving safety or official presence.
